Eadred was a paladin member of AkhVelahr who was trapped by a curse inside the Cold Knights Barrow of Glim-Gardens since the early days of the Weeping Wars 712 DR.
Eadred was fairly handsome and muscular.
Eadred was an idealistic and heroic young man.
Eadred was one of Hachaam Selorns subordinates who went deep respect for his commander, enough to sacrifice his life to free Hachaam from his cursed imprisonment.
Eadred was famous for his swordmanship, honed to perfection. As a paladin, he had a will of iron, proficiency with most weapons and heavy armor, and the full array of divine spells from his deity.
Eadred went into the cursed stasis wearing his enchanted +1 plate armor as well as his softly padded gloves of dexterity.
thumb|Eadred, trapped in the cold eternal stasis.|275x275px
Eadred was one of the paladin members of Myth Drannors AkhVelahr under Hachaam Selorns command. Sometime before the start of the Weeping War, Eadred and Hachaam visited one of the ancient tombs in Glim-Gardens, the Cold Knights Barrow, also known as the Tomb of Eternal Sleep, which was home to a powerful wight who was plaguing the City of Song. Together the two AkhVelahr managed to slay the ravenous undead, but Hachaam was trapped in frozen stasis by the wights final spell, appearing cold and eternally in stasis. In 712 DR, when the danger of the looming war became apparent, Eadred returned to the barrow by the House Ammath mansion, seeking the way to free the commander whose leadership was needed. He managed to take Hachaams place in eternal slumber, freeing the Arm-Captain just in time for him to lead Myth Drannors forces against the invading Army of Darkness that succeeded in destroying the city in 714 DR. With the city being gone, no-one was left alive who could rescue the paladin, leaving him trapped inside the ancient tomb.
In 1369 DR, a group of adventurers came across the cursed man. The Veiled Ones were on a quest to stop the Cult of the Dragons corruption of the mythal and the pool of radiance within the ruins of Myth Drannor. Seeing the man, one of the heroes grasped the sword in the altar and was taken by the curse. This act of unintended kindness freed Eadred for the first time in centuries. He Joined the heroes in the quest to stop vile Kya Mordrayn, but eventually, reclaimed his prison, freeing the trapped hero.
